reviewText:
Early Access Review

I don't recomend this game. I understand it is a early access game, but as it is, it in no ways can justify the 17.99$ price tag.

It is a nice cliche concept. You are locked in a hospital with a madman... And it shows potential. However, said madman is not spooky thanks for very casual voice work and animation. Also it has glitches all around, minor things like getting stuck in floor and getting stabbed because your brilliant protagonist can't evade a box of soap ( or whatever ) is not helping either.

This game shows almost the same pricetag as Outlast. It can't compete against outlast in any ways in it's current state. IF the game was priced 5$ or lower, i would have been more forgiving. It could evolve into something worthwhile. In due time i will revisit this game to see if i will change my rating and if it got better.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Pros:
Sorta scary on first play through

Cons:
Very poor graphics
Doorways are a bit janky
Extremely dark
Jeff gets stuck all over the place
Can't access setting after starting
Can't Save
Has QTE but doesn't tell you what button so you have to figure it out

Don't remember actually purchasing this game and really hope i got it in a humblebundle or something.  For 15.99 this game is a ripoff.  Went through a doorway and my lighter turned off. Can assume its either part of the story, out of fuel, or the game is broken.  Can't get to the options to mess with the settings so I can't see anything on my screen other than black and circles of light.  Was a bug I got my lighter back when I ran back and let Jeff kill me.
The enemy will just disappear when you are looking right at him.  Often gets stuck in random spots along the way.  Seemed to have a spot that was the idle spot until the player was detected.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I liked the idea of the story, but the optimization and controls really prevent me from recommending the game as it is currently. Some of the resolutions just dont work. Selecting them will reset you to full screen and max resolution. Running  a gtx970, graphics were stuttering after first entering the hospital. After first entering the hospital, I ran into a bug where I somehow got stuck in a wall and had to alt-f4 the game, only to have it crash when restarting. When I did get the game to start properly, I noticed that doors are an inexact science, and it was very easy to get stuck in them, or accidently turn off a light switch trying to open a door.

On the good side, the audio is pretty solidly spooky, though the volume slider in the options seems broken or maybe it was resetting like the resolution bug.

Again, maybe its just because its very early into the early access thing, and it does look the like dev's are actively working on it, so I look forward to some bug fixes so I can give the game a real try. But right now, I would probably wait to buy.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Early Access?
Just so you'll be warned..this *game* has more bugs than a 3rd class dump.
Only playing for a few minutes and needed to close (nothing working) the game 3 times.
What I've seen so far? Rooms with graphics that are horrible. Most of the inventar you can't use.....just for the fun, what would you do, if you stumble in an unknown location and find a working telephone? (at last it beeps)...but you can't use it.
Now there is something inside a boddybag....and you are an journalist...wouldn't you just peek a look? Not gone happen.
There is a working x-ray machine...but you can't turn on the lights and must use your lighter????

I would say wait till its in Beta and than test it out...or better...seek something worth playing. For 15.99 â‚¬ there are better choices.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I do like the premise of this game i love creepypastas to the point where i am always reading or watching videos about them everyday this game has something that i enjoy but it does come with a price.This game has alot going for it but needs to be looked at some of the problems are in the gameplay aspect like jeff the killers A.I sucks gets stuck on corners,doors etc.The voice acting is okay but could be creepier sometimes dialog will repeat on a loop which is very annoying!

The game looks good on ultra settings but some sound effects are missing somethimes there is no sense of direction because the game makes you do everything even finding objects that are very hard to see somethimes.The quick time events are really bad but do add for some funny fight sences which needs to be improved alot.Chartacter models are okay but jeff needs to be more creepy because he is not really that scary if you are making dlc for this game make sure its free and adds new creepypasta monters like slender etc.I have done youtube videos on this game and it was fun to play but poorly programmed so i would give this game a 5/10 but should not be worth Â£15.00 at all!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Very interesting game, it has such high potential! The creators seem to be making a very valuable effort towards this game. Jeff the Killer has been one of my favorite Creepypastas for awhile and it's great to finally see a GOOD game made around him.

Anyway, an actual review of the game. Before the update yesterday... the environment seemed a tad TOO dark and the lighter did very little. I'm aware it's early access, but it was a bit too short, Jeff's AI seemed a little wonky, as he kept walking through walls and ignoring me completely. Other than all that, I enjoyed the bit of time I spent playing this game and am looking forward to further updates.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I made a Let's Play of this game and I have to say it was amazing. I had lots of fun being chased by Jeff. He is definately very very creepy when he chases you. The music also is a nice touch to him chasing you.

So my pros are:
Scary for sure, some paranormal mixed with a great creepypasta is success in my book.
Great detail when it came to the scenery and graphic detail. I'm glad they went out of their way to animate the outside. The sunset was beautiful.
This Jeff the killer game is by far the best that I have ever seen compared to the other ones on Youtube and so on. (both graphical and scary wise).
It was straight forward and there weren't a lot of puzzles, which was nice because it didn't need a lot to begin with.

My cons are:
It has some minor graphic issues like when you hide in the closet the door blocks the view or seeing jeff on the other side of the door.
I would of liked to see him wander if he loses you along with chasing you into rooms. It is early access after all so I'm sure it will be implemented at some point.
It is a little short, would of liked to push jeff out of the elevator and climb through the top to try and get away. (Maybe a sequel or addition?)

Overall I would greatly recommend this game to anyone looking for a little horror in their life, or even to a Jeff the Killer fan. Hope to see more from this developer. Definately was a good game. :)

Also I'd like to note that this game is in EARLY ACCESS. So it isn't finished yet. They have a plan and a list of issues they know about. Including the Jeff AI so bare with them. They are working on it. :)

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nIt might be early access, this game has shown very interesting things. Jeff the killer's voice is unexpected but fits well, giving him personality. The atmosphere is so quiet it gets me worried all the time. The hospital is well designed and realistc in its architecture, which is not always the case when you look at other games of this kind. I really enjoyed the short time I played so far, and I really look forward to see it fully done !
